item.title: Borderlands 4 Nintendo Switch 2 Development Paused by Take-Two
item.content:encoded:
Plans to bring Borderlands 4 to the Nintendo Switch 2 are currently on pause.

Take-Two Interactive is pausing development of Borderlands 4 for Nintendo Switch 2, as stated in its most recent quarterly earnings on Tuesday, February 3.

A spokesperson told Variety that it was a difficult decision to pause development of a Nintendo Switch 2 release for Borderlands 4. However, they say they remain committed to delivering high-quality post-launch content and to working closely with Nintendo to release additional projects on the platform.

“We’re continuing to collaborate closely with our friends at Nintendo. We have ‘PGA Tour 2K25’ coming out and ‘WWE 2K26’ [for Switch 2], and we’re incredibly excited about bringing more of our titles to that platform in the future,” said spokesperson Alan Lewis.

Borderlands 4 Content Coming in 2026

Gearbox recently announced the 2026 content coming to Borderlands 4. In addition to the recently released Photo Mode, story updates, the packs, and more are coming to the game throughout this calendar year. Check out the full Roadmap here.

Are you disappointed by this news, or would you prefer the focus to be on the current versions of Borderlands 4? Sound off in our official Discord server.

For more on Take-Two games coming to Nintendo Switch 2, check out the updates coming to WWE 2K26 specifically for the latest Nintendo Switch. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: GTA 6 Marketing To Start This Summer, Will Have Physical Version
item.content:encoded:
The Grand Theft Auto 6 (GTA 6) marketing train is getting ready to get into full gear.

As part of the company’s quarterly earnings report on Tuesday, Take-Two Interactive confirmed that marketing for GTA 6 will begin this summer.

On top of that, CEO Strauss Zelnick address concerns about a lack of a physical version of the game when it launches in the fall.

In speaking with Variety, Zelnick was asked about the claims that Take-Two Interactive was going to withhold from a physical release of GTA 6 until 2027 in order to prevent leaks before launch. To that notion, Zelnick bluntly said that it was “not the plan”.

GTA 6 is scheduled to launch for Xbox Series X|S and PlayStation 5 on November 19, 2026. Take-Two reaffirmed the release date as part of the same earnings report.

When do you think GTA 6 will start getting more feature reveals and new trailers? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more news, read about former Rockstar North president Leslie Benzies denying the sexual assault allegations against him. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

Rainbow Six Siege Creative Director Stepping Down from Role

Alex Karpazis, the creative director on Rainbow Six Siege, is stepping down and being replaced by Joshua Mills, it has been revealed.

Ubisoft Union Reps Call For CEO Yves Guillemot’s Resignation

Two Ubisoft union representatives are calling for the resignation of CEO Yves Guillemot after the announced restructuring and layoffs.

item.title: Take-Two Interactive Reaffirms GTA 6 Will Launch November 19, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Grand Theft Auto 6 publisher, Take-Two Interactive, has reaffirmed that GTA 6 is still scheduled to release on November 19, 2026.

The update came as part of Take-Two Interactive’s quarterly earnings call, where Take-Two CEO, Strauss Zelnick said,

“With ongoing momentum across many of our businesses, and the highly anticipated launch of Grand Theft Auto VI on November 19th, we continue to project record levels of Net Bookings in Fiscal 2027, which we believe will establish a new financial baseline for our business, set us on a path to enhanced profitability, and provide further balance sheet strength and flexibility.”

It’s said that marketing for the game will also begin this “this summer”, so eargely awaiting fans will have to wait a little longer to be able to see more on the game.

As of yet, Take-Two Interactive have only confirmed the release date of GTA 6 for the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series S|X for November 19, 2026.

Do you think Grand Theft Auto 6 will finally release on November 19, 2026? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Epic Games gave away 662 million free games last year

Tom Henderson is Insider Gaming's Co-Founder and Editor-In-Chief. When he's not running one of the industry's leading independent video game websites, he's probably playing an FPS like Call of Duty,…
